page.title: 12HISTORY OF BOYATT WOOD
page.content: The history of{Boyatt Wood}can be traced back to Saxon times.In the Domesday Book it is mentioned as {'Boviete'}and was held by{Herbrand the {Norman.}However, despite being mentioned in statutes of Richard 1 and Henry VIII and also in the 17th. and 18th.centuries, it never flourished as a community. It never had it's own church. By 1860,it contained only 16 houses.Indeed Arthur Drewitt in his book 'Eastleigh's Yesterdays' published in 1935 said that by 1860 Boyatt as a community was dead. In 1985,such a statement seems impossible to believe for Boyatt is now a rapidly developing residential and commercial centre.{The Crestwood Community School {and Centre}was built to give the local residents much needed recreational and educational facilities and is the nucleus of Boyatt.
